alert.note: Alert for Cheshire; Coastal Rockingham; Eastern Hillsborough; Interior Rockingham; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 9:29PM EST until February 23 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...LOW PRESSURE TO BRING SNOW AND MIXED PRECIPITATION TO THE REGION TONIGHT AND THURSDAY... .Low pressure will move across southern New England late tonight and Thursday. Snow is expected to overspread the area from west to east tonight and may be heavy at times overnight into early Thursday morning. Sleet may mix in late tonight and Thursday morning, mainly across southern New Hampshire. Another period of snow or mixed precipitation may occur Thursday night into early Friday with more minor accumulations possible. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations between 3 and 5 inches for a storm total of 4 to 6 inches, sleet accumulations around one half of an inch and ice accumulations around a light glaze. * WHERE...Western and Central Hillsborough, Cheshire, Coastal Rockingham, Eastern Hillsborough, and Interior Rockingham Counties. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...A period of mixed precipitation is expected with air temperatures remaining below freezing. Expect slippery road conditions and avoid travel if possible. Even light snowfall amounts can accumulate on roads and cause dangerous driving conditions due to snow covered roads. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
